results.title: Basketball arcade cabinet
results.brief_description: Before NBA Jam, there was Atari’s Basketball. Released just in time for the arcade heyday of the early 1980s, it was the first basketball game to use a trackball controller and a 45-degree angled side view.

constellations_primary.name: Atari’s Basketball
constellations_primary.description: Released in 1979, just in time for the arcade heydays of the early 1980s, Atari’s Basketball was the first basketball game to use a trackball as the input mechanic and a 45-degree angled side view. This set the standard for basketball games that followed.

results.description: Before NBA Jam and the NBA 2K basketball series, there was Atari’s Basketball. Released in 1979, just in time for the arcade heydays of the early 1980s, it was the first basketball game to use a trackball as the input mechanic and a 45-degree angled side view. Not only did this become part of the playbook for basketball games that followed, but Basketball was also the first sports game where the pixelated sprites players controlled actually looked like people. The game unit’s neon graphic design is also uniquely of its time and reflects the burgeoning videogame aesthetic.
description_for_label: Before NBA Jam and the NBA 2K basketball series, there was Atari’s Basketball. Released in 1979, just in time for the arcade heydays of the early 1980s, it was the first basketball game to use a trackball as the input mechanic and a 45-degree angled side view. Not only did this become part of the playbook for basketball games that followed, but Basketball was also the first sports game where the pixelated sprites players controlled actually looked like people. The game unit’s neon graphic design is also uniquely of its time and reflects the burgeoning videogame aesthetic.

results.title: Sony Handycam DCR-SX65
results.brief_description: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 debuted in 1985 and while other models from the era have been discontinued, it’s been made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but camcorders like this have captured footage that has social and political ramifications.

constellations_primary.name: A handheld aesthetic
constellations_primary.description: Looking at the use of handycams and other consumer level devices in moving image works.

results.description: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 is what it says: it’s a handy camera. Debuting on the market in 1985, its name came from its compact size that allowed it to fit in the user’s hand and capture their everyday lives more easily. While other models from this era have been discontinued, the Sony Handycam DCR-SX65’s popularity has seen it made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but their cost and convivence meant camcorders like this have been used to capture amateur footage that has social and political ramifications all around the world.
description_for_label: The Sony Handycam DCR-SX65 is what it says: it’s a handy camera. Debuting on the market in 1985, its name came from its compact size that allowed it to fit in the user’s hand and capture their everyday lives more easily. While other models from this era have been discontinued, the Sony Handycam DCR-SX65’s popularity has seen it made in various formats ever since. Home videos might have been their original purpose, but their cost and convivence meant camcorders like this have been used to capture amateur footage that has social and political ramifications all around the world.

results.title: Model 621 Sound Projector with tripod and stand
results.credit_line: ACMI Collection. Tripod donated by Daryl Annett.
results.brief_description: In 1951, this projector was brought to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia to entertain workers during the shearing season.

constellations_primary.name: Bell & Howell Projector 621: This picture has been edited for content
constellations_primary.description: The Bell & Howell-Gaumont Model 621 projector was originally used entertain the shearers on a sheep farm in South Australia with the films screened sometimes edited for distribution.

results.title_for_label: Model 621 Sound Projector with tripod and stand
results.description: Though it was made in England, this projector made it over 15,000kms to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia. Situated on pastoral land in the Murray and Mellee region of South Australia, Koomooloo Station operated as a sheep station from 1868 and in 1951, this projector was bought to entertain workers during the shearing season. Luckily it has a vent at the back of the casing to keep it cool because if it was used inside a shearing shed the heat would’ve been insufferable.
description_for_label: Though it was made in England, this projector made it over 15,000kms to the Koomooloo Station in South Australia. Situated on pastoral land in the Murray and Mellee region of South Australia, Koomooloo Station operated as a sheep station from 1868 and in 1951, this projector was bought to entertain workers during the shearing season. Luckily it has a vent at the back of the casing to keep it cool because if it was used inside a shearing shed the heat would’ve been insufferable.
results.credit_line_for_label: ACMI Collection. Tripod donated by Daryl Annett.

results.title: My Brilliant Career paperback
results.brief_description: My Brilliant Career, adapted from Stella Miles Franklin’s 1901 novel of the same name, was Gillian Armstrong’s first feature film and a global success, gaining Academy Award and Palme d’Or nominations.

constellations_primary.name: Pen names, poems and puppets
constellations_primary.description: Discover how big-screen adaptations of novels connect to web-based poetry and Jim Henson's Fraggle Rock.

results.description: Paperback book ‘My Brilliant Career’, with soft cover and the title written on front in red ‘My Brilliant Career’, on a black background and in white text authors name ‘Miles Franklin’.
